title: Beatrice Krebs
text:
Beatrice Krebs (March 12, 1924 – February 5, 2011) was an American <a href="opera">opera</a>tic <a href="mezzo-soprano">mezzo-soprano</a>, musical theatre actress, and voice teacher.
Life and career.
Born in <a href="Cleveland">Cleveland</a>, Krebs made her professional opera debut in 1952 at the <a href="New%20York%20City%20Opera">New York City Opera</a> (NYCO) as Miss Todd in <a href="Gian%20Carlo%20Menotti">Gian Carlo Menotti</a>'s "<a href="The%20Old%20Maid%20and%20the%20Thief">The Old Maid and the Thief</a>". In 1956 she portrayed Mama McCourt in the world premiere of <a href="Douglas%20Moore">Douglas Moore</a>'s "<a href="The%20Ballad%20of%20Baby%20Doe">The Ballad of Baby Doe</a>" at the <a href="Central%20City%20Opera">Central City Opera</a>. She repeated that role for the opera's NYCO premiere in 1958 and on the 1959 NYCO recording of the opera. She can also be heard on the 1959 recording of <a href="Igor%20Stravinsky">Igor Stravinsky</a>'s "<a href="Threni%20%28Stravinsky%29">Threni</a>" with the <a href="Columbia%20Symphony%20Orchestra">Columbia Symphony Orchestra</a>. From 1961 to 1963 she performed the role of the Mother Abbess in the first national tour of "<a href="The%20Sound%20of%20Music">The Sound of Music</a>" with <a href="Florence%20Henderson">Florence Henderson</a> as Maria. After the tour ended, she joined the voice faculty at <a href="Carnegie%20Mellon%20University">Carnegie Mellon University</a> in 1963. She was later promoted to the position of head of the voice faculty at that institution. She died in <a href="Golden%20Valley%2C%20Minnesota">Golden Valley, Minnesota</a> in 2011 at the age of 86.
